conclusion: Analyzing the motion of blocks A and B connected by a spring
Two blocks A and B connected by a spring; force F applied upward on block A; gravity and spring forces act on blocks
Define variables: mass m, spring constant k, force F, gravitational acceleration g; find initial acceleration of block A
Initially, system is at rest with block B on the ground; spring is at natural length
Free body diagram for block A: force F upward, weight mg downward, spring force depends on displacement
Free body diagram for block B: weight mg downward, spring force upward, normal force from ground upward
Block B leaves ground when normal force is zero; spring force on B equals weight of B
Set up equations: spring force on B equals mg; displacement x₂ = 0; kx₁ = mg
Newton's second law for block A: F - mg - kx₁ = ma
Solve for initial acceleration: at initial state, x₁ = 0, spring force is zero; a = (F - mg)/m = F/m - g
Final answer: magnitude of initial acceleration of block A is |F/m - g|
